text: Jean Ping (; born 24 November 1942)UN profile page."Jean Ping Ministre des Affaires étrangères, de la Coopération et de la Francophonie", Jeune Afrique, 5 January 2003 ."Gabon: Biographie du nouveau président de la Commission de l’Union Africaine, Jean Ping", Gabonews, 2 February 2008 . is a Gabonese diplomat and politician. He was the Minister of State and Minister of Foreign Affairs, Cooperation and Francophonie of the Gabonese Republic from 1999 to 2008, and was President of the United Nations General Assembly from 2004 to 2005 and Chairperson of the Commission of the African Union from 2008 to 2012. Ping was a candidate in the 2016 Gabonese presidential election against the outgoing president Ali Bongo. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:Gabonese politicians Category:Chairpersons of the African Union Commission Category:Living people Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly Category:African diplomats
title: Jean Ping
